enamelled trinket boxes brought to her Windsor Castle home for her to see.The pictures, taken on Wednesday, come amid reports that the frail Queen has been using a wheelchair and just days before she hopes to attend a memorial service for her late husband Prince Philip at Westminster Abbey next week.In the new images, wearing half-moon glasses to examine the artefacts, the Queen peers at the luxury pieces by British craftwork firm Halcyon Days, which is held in such high esteem by the royals it has three Royal Warrants.  She also watched a demonstration of traditional enamelling and gilding by hand by master artisans - all in the comfort of her own royal residence. The Queen was due to visit the Halcyon Days factory in Staffordshire in  to mark its own Platinum Jubilee of  years, but plans were put on hold when the pandemic struck.Much has changed since the outbreak of Covid-, with the Queen, , now using a walking stick, confessing to mobility problems, and usually carrying out only light duties at Windsor.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. The intricately-decorated coffee cups and saucers and enamelled boxes were laid out on a white linen-covered table in the White Drawing Room. The Queen was said to have particularly enjoyed the visit, picking up some of the tiny enamelled boxes to inspect them. Among the items was a selection of the earliest designs - the company was founded in  just two years before the start of the Queenaposs reign.Taking a closer look at the antique pieces, the Queen held a small oval Windsor Castle trinket box with a red base, decorated with a black and white painting of the monarchaposs favourite royal residence. She also picked up a larger rectangular trinket box, edged in lavender, featuring three colour portraits of her late mother the Queen Mother as a young woman. The enamelled piece was released in  and features Samuel Warburtonaposs  triptych painting of the Queen Mother in the year she married the Queenaposs father.  The Queen Mother was an avid fan of the firmaposs creations, and first commissioned an enamel box in  of her London home Clarence House. Other members of the royal family soon followed suit, and the Queen Mother went on to issue the companyaposs first Royal Warrant in . The monarch also saw Halcyon Daysapos first-ever year box - from the Silver Jubilee of  - and viewed new Platinum Jubilee pieces which are dark blue and painted with platinum flowers of the realm.  Perched on the crook of the Queenaposs left arm was her trademark black patent Launer handbag, and she also held her walking stick as she stood to look at the display. She wore a sentimental piece of jewellery - her Flower Basket brooch - a basket of gem-studded flowers set with diamonds, sapphires, rubies and emeralds, which she was given by her parents in  to mark the birth of her first child, Prince Charles. The event was the Queenaposs first official face-to-face engagement with a number of people for more than seven weeks since her Platinum Jubilee reception at Sandringham House. title: boy 10 left screaming sobbing
story: Boy, , left screaming and sobbing after missing skiing trip in passport rowReuben Murphy,  missed out on a much anticipated school trip after his passport didnt come on time. Mum Kirsty Morgan said the Passport Office and courier firm TNT were "blaming each other" for the no-show passportReuben Murphy, , in his skiing gear, was looking forward to the trip with his school matesByAlan WestonSamantha Mordi:,  Mar A mum has said telling her son he couldnapost go on much-anticipated ski trip due to passport delays, has been one of the most heartbreaking experiences of her le. Reuben Murphyaposs child passport didnapost come within a four-week timeframe, leaving her son screaming and sobbing as he missed out on one of the last school trips with his primary school friends.Kirsty Morgan from Liverpool had to let her excited son down, as she broke the news which left him devastated, the Liverpool Echo reports.The -year-old said: I was told I could have it cancelled and an emergency one reissuedI went to the passport office, so I did three times only to be told by a manager there was nothing they could do. No one could tell me exactly where my sonaposs passport was. She says that the Passport Office and courier firm TNT were blaming each other for the passport not arriving on time.  Kirsty said: I had to tell an excited  year old boy whoaposs in his last year of school heaposs not going skiing with his friends. It was one of the most heartbreaking experiences of my le. He was devastated, screaming and sobbing.At one point Kirsty claimed she was told she could go to Liverpool John Lennon Airportshe wanted to pick up the passport in person, only to receive a text the next day to say it had already been loaded on the van.But despite this, the vital document still did not arrive in time for the necessary tests to be carried out before Reuben could travel with his friends from All Saints Catholic Primary School in Anfield. She said: People had applied in the same time frame as me and had their passport within two weeks and it was first time too. Reubenaposs was a renewal, it was his third passport. Iaposm absolutely disgusted. Iaposve never heard him so upset as that in all my le when I told him he couldnapost go. It was so sad, it was like somebody had died. A Passport Office spokesperson said: As is clearly indicated in our online guidance people should allow up to  weeks to get their passport when applying from the UK, or they can apply via a one-week fast track service for child passport renewals. story: When do free Covid lateral flow and PCR tests end – as daily infections top ,Free lateral flow tests will no longer be available for those without Covid symptoms, but those with symptoms will also not be able to get PCR tests from next monthFree Covid lateral flow tests will end soon Image: Getty ImagesByAriane Sohrabi-ShirazSEO Editor:,  Mar |comments More than , cases of Covid- were recorded yesterday , with  deaths recorded.This latest infection figure is more than % higher than on the same day last week.Although infection levels continue to soar, those in England will soon not be able to order free tests to find outthey have Covid. The government scheme is due to end soon, unless you fall into specic categories. Here is everything you need to know.When do free lateral flow tests end   You will no longer be able to get free lateral flow tests from Friday, April , unless you are over , or over  with a weakened immune system. Everyone  will have to purchase teststhey wish. Those eligible will only be able to order one pack of seven LFTs every three days. Previously this was once per day. In Scotland, limited free tests will be available until the end of April, with Wales keeping some testing capacity until July. This change comes because people in England are no longer required to self isolatethey have Covid.However, staying at home and avoiding contact with others for five days is still recommended by the NHS. The updated guidance, which comes as part of the governmentaposs Living with Covid plan, reads: Most tests are now needed for people at higher risk in England,” and those “without Covid- symptoms no longer need to take rapid lateral flow tests.The government is making sure that tests are available for people who need them most, including NHS workers, vulnerable iniduals and those visiting high risk settings. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge echoed the Queen and Prince Philip as they attended their final engagement in Jamaica today on day six of their Caribbean tour. The couple were at a passing out parade of the Jamaican Defence Force, where Prince William inspected service personnel from across the Caribbean who have recently completed the Caribbean Military Academy’s Officer Training Programme.Kate looked elegant in a white lace McQueen dress with matching white heels and a hat by milliner Philip Treacy as she sat in the stands with dignitaries to watch the parade. William, who inspected the officers before joining Kate in the stands, wore the topical dress of the Blues and Royals for the event.  When the event was over, they travelled away in the same open-top Land Rover that transported Williamaposs grandparents in Jamaica on their visits to the Caribbean Island in  and . The Queen and Prince Philip also visited Jamaica in  when they travelled in another Land Rover and greeted school children.William also gave a speech at the event, where he talked about good leadership and paid a direct tribute to the Queen.He said: As Catherine and I visit Jamaica in celebration of The Queen’s Platinum Jubilee, I thought I might quote my grandmother on the subject.  In an address to the United Nations General Assembly in , she said: ‘I know of no single formula for success, but over the years I have observed that some attributes of leadership are universal, and are often about finding ways of encouraging people to combine their efforts, their talents, their insights, their enthusiasm and their inspiration, to work together.’ I think that’s a very good model to follow. William also quoted reggae legend Bob Marley in the speech when he told those at the parade that being asked to lead men and women through uncertainty and danger is daunting. He added: ‘You never know how strong you are, until being strong is your only choice. The Commissioning Parade was comprised of  officer cadets from across the Caribbean including from Jamaica, Antigua and Barbuda, Barbados, Guyana and St Kitts. A series of march pasts took place starting with one from The President’s Platoon, with the duke standing to attention for each one.When it was over, Kate gingerly walked up into the back of the vehicle via three red velvet steps with her husband’s help because of her heels.William then joined her and they stood holding handle bar as the vehicle slowly moved off work a motorcycle escort.As they did, the crowd was told that the pristine Land Rover was acquired by the Jamaican Defence Force in . It has just  kilometres on the clock since it was built in .After freshening up they walked to the officers’ club, Kate hanging into her hat in the gusty weather. Inside they split up to talk to several dferent groups of soldiers and their families.William chatted to a group of officers from Sandhurst who have been helping to organise the officers’ training programme for the last  months. I thought their drill was pretty good, he said. Really impressive. Among those he spoke to was Captain Matt Tiley who had worked as a groom in the Royal Mews at Buckingham Palace for four years before going into the military and passing out at Sandhurst. He is now an instructor there with Marne Company. He said: It’s been such an honour to work with them. They have all been so enthusiastic. The duke clearly has fond memories of Sandhust. William told another group that they should take time to enjoy the day with their families like he did. ‘They should be very proud of you,’ he said.He and the duchess signed a visitors book before they left to change for their official departure from Jamaica . Later this afternoon William and Kate will fly on to the Bahamas, where they will stay until Saturday evening.Last night, they attended a glittering state dinner at the house of Jamaicaaposs Governor General in Kingston, where Kate dazzled in a green Jenny Packham gown and jewellery on loan from the Queen. She paired the dress with her Royal Family Order and GVCO Star - although there was no tiara. She also wore her hair in a chic updo. William, who gave a speech expressing his “profound sorrow” over the stain of slavery on Britain, also looked suave in black tie. During his speech, William said he “strongly agreed” with his father Prince Charles’s previous declaration that Britain is forever stained by its role in the global slave trade.He said: “Slavery was abhorrent. title: men spend four days nights
story: Exclusive: Men spend four days and nights climbing huge roof crack below M motorway bridgeThese incredible pictures show the moment two expert climbers clung on by their fingertips to complete one of their most dficult ascents - on the underside of the M.The bridge which thousands of cars pass over each dayByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsTwo expert climbers complete their most challenging climb - on the underside of the MTom Randall, , and Pete Whittaker, , are up there with the best roof crack climbers in the world but unfortunately, they were unable to travel during the coronavirus pandemic and so had to put training on hold.After they grew tired of waiting for restrictions to be lted, they racked their brains for a way to replicate the same conditions and then it hit them - bridges.They put out a call of action to their fans and enlisted an army on social media to help them track down the perfect bridge, and eventually, they found it - part of the M in Devon, over the River Exe.Now known as The Great Rt, the climb is around mand Tom, from Sheffield, said it was the biggest roof crack weaposll ever do. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Tom said: I don’t think it’s been done before, that’s for sure. It all happened because me and my climbing partner are the world’s most established or experienced roof crack climbers, and we’ve done most of the worldaposs hardest roof crack climbs.We had the pandemic and couldn’t travel, so we started hunting under bridges for the same thing.We thought they might exist between the concrete girders beneath bridges, we personally visited maybe hundreds and also had a whole Instagram and social media community looking out for them for us. We had people from all over the world looking for us.The one we settled on came from a friend who said they’d spotted something on Google maps, and another person from the area who said we should go check it out. It was just one of those on a whim vague suggestions that might work out, and it actually did.When Tom visited the site he was amazed, as he was expecting to see some sort of obstacle blocking the climb but instead he was greeted by unspoilt concrete as far as the eye could see.He continued: I was pretty certain it was something that was very very unique. I’ve looked at a lot of bridge roof cracks and I’ve never seen anything that – it’s continuous with no breaks in it, very clean line with no obstructing girders. It’s a once in a letime thing and I feel very lucky to have found it. Plus it was in Devon, so we could get to it.The Great Rt took Tom and Pete almost four whole days to complete, and during that time they never once touched the ground - sleeping on a ledge that they strung up beneath the M.The climb has been referred to as the aposEl Capapos of Bridges, referring to the iconic rock formation in Yosemite National Park, which was climbed without ropes by Alex Honnold in .Tom continued: On a bridge, the main things are that the concrete flexes and moves continually, so it’s a little bit scary because the protection youaposre placing in the crack feels less reliable, and the handholds are constantly moving size. It’s very noisy because of the M traffic, and it’s very dirty because of the dust and oil residue has washed down the crack. And you’ve got the public thinking you’re some kind of protester. They tend to call the police too, they came out and we got pulled down the first time. It took us four days to complete the climb, we slept on a portable bed underneath the M. Iaposve done it a lot, I’ve been climbing for  years. For the general population, it seems bizarre and scary, butyou’re a professional climber it’s a tool of the trade so you’re used to it. Not under the M though, that’s pretty unique. It’s a touch quieter at night. In the daytime, it is very noisy but it quietens down a bit. It’s a climb with a great deal of irony, we’re supposed to be out in the wilds and enjoying nature but there we are under the M. It feels very British, and bizarre.Lots of other things we’ve done are a bit odd so it fits in well - If you ask people in the climbing industry about us they’ll tell you we do things dferently.Tom and Pete are both professional climbers and would like to thank their sponsors Raab, Wild Country, Rhino Skin, Tendon Ropes, Unparalleled Shoes, Sterling Ropes and Patagonia.Their story features in the documentary Bridge Boys, which premieres in Reel Rock, an annual climbing film festival, on March . Tickets are available here. title: mothers day exact day changes
story: When is Mothers Day   Why date changes yearly as Mothering Sunday falls this weekendMothers Day, or Mothering Sunday as its traditionally known, is fast approaching this weekend. The day has a long history and came about through years of dferent sorts of celebrations and traditionsMothers Day is a celebration of mums everywhere and is a great chance to show your mum what she means to you Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByBenjamin LynchTrends Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsMotheraposs Day is upon us once again this weekend as families across the world gear up to celebrate everything our mums have done for us There are plenty of great Motheraposs Day gts and deals out there for people to take advantage of, including last-minute flower bouquets and bargain gts. The history of the day goes back a long way and is related to the Christian calendar, but its meaning has changed over time. The meaning can also y from person to person. For some, it is a chance to spend time with and give thanks to their mum, while for others it is a chance to honour the memory of people who have passed away. So when is Motheraposs Day, also known as Mothering Sunday  When is Motheraposs Day   Motheraposs Day  falls on Sunday, March . The term aposMotheraposs Dayapos technically means the day dedicated to the celebration of mums everywhere, whereas Mothering Sunday tended to refer to a Christian tradition that began in the th century where people would visit either the church they grew up in or were baptised.  The dates for the next few years are as follows: - March   - March   - March   - March Why does the Motheraposs Day date change   The celebration falls on the fourth Sunday in Lent and the date changes depending on Easter and the Christian calendar. Easter and Lent changes every year depending on the cycle of the moon and means that Easter Sunday can occur on any Sunday between March  and April . Motheraposs Day shouldnapost be confused with the day in the US, which always falls on the second Sunday in May. Why do we celebrate Motheraposs Day   There are ious reasons we celebrate Motheraposs Day, but it is now seen as a chance to be grateful to our mum for everything they have done for us over the years Until recently it was more commonly known as aposMothering Sundayapos. There were ancient Greek festivals that celebrated motherhood as well in honour of their god Rhea and festivals were also held by the Romans, so the tradition is nothing new. In Europe and the UK, a special service would see people ing to their aposmother churchapos during Lent.  Like with other Christian holidays, such as Christmas and Easter, the day has become more of a secular tradition and widely commercialised. In the US, abolitionist and suffragette Julia Ward Howe set up Mothers’ Friendship Day in the wake of the American Civil War in  to promote reconciliation with the mothers of Union and Confederate troops. In fact, Anna Jarvis, who pushed for the idea for Motheraposs Day to be celebrated in the US as part of the national calendar, eventually criticised the commercialisation of the day and lobbied to have it removed. Jarvis was the daughter of Ann Reeves Jarvis, who had set up work clubs for mums to come together. Anna had originally campaigned to have it as part of the national calendar and President Woodrow Wilson officially added it in . title: ms say sorry after staff
story: MS say sorry after staff stopped busting mum full of tea from using toiletSue Smith, , was left "busting" for the toilet after the MS she splashed out on cake and tea in refused to let her use the toilets shortly before the store shutSue Smith spent the evening at the MS store as an early mothers day treat Image: Darren Quinton Birmingham LiveByIan JohnsonKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments MS have apologised after a mum was left “bursting” for the loo as she claimed their staff refused to let her use the toilet, despite being a customer.Sue Smith visited the York MS store for an early mother’s day treat of tea and cake last Sunday. However, she tried to use the toilet as the branch was shutting down but was left “fuming” after she was told it was store policy not to let anyone use them after the tannoy had sounded.The chain apologised to the -year-old, and insisted that she should have been allowed to use it,Teesside Live reported .Instead of letting Ms Smith use the toilet, she was forced to endure an uncomfortable hour-plus long drive home before she could finally go to the toilet. She slammed the decision as “daft” not to let her go and that she was “full of tea”.  She said: It wasnapost like we had just come off the streets, we were actually in the shop and paying customers”. After she had splashed out in the city centre restaurant she was flabbergasted that staff wouldn’t let her go to the toilet. She said: We came out the restaurant having tea and cake, so three of us said aposWe have to go as the shopaposs closingapos. “So we got up and walked towards the toilet, around  yards away on the same floor, and we saw this lad in his Hi-vis coat. As we walked towards the toilet, a couple of girls came out and then the Tannoy announcer said aposThe shopaposs closing in ten minutes, can you make your way to the checkouts.’ “But when we got to the toilet he said we couldnapost come in once they made the ten minute announcement.At the time we were so polite, but we should have said aposDonapost be so daftapos and walked past - what would he have done  But we didnapost because we are too nice. But I was fuming, absolutely fuming - and busting. To help her, her daughter tried to take her to a public convenience, only to find that it too had shut. They said it has marred what had otherwise been a “lovely” day, and when she made it home she fired off a complaint to MS. However, the national chain didn’t reply until Teeside Live raised her concerns with the high street giant. Since then ,a spokesperson for the firm claried that the toilets should always remain open to customers as long as the store is.  We were sorry to hear about Ms Smith’s experience. At MS we hold ourselves to the highest standards of customer service and our toilets are available for customers to use whenever our store is open., they added. We are contacting Ms Smith directly to apologise and our store manager would like to offer her some flowers next time she visits the store.” And Sue also claims that, days later, the firm eventually did reply - and also offered her a £ voucher. title: mum left devastated doctors say
story: Mum left devastated as doctors say her two sons wont live past the age of Courtney Webber has shared her heartbreak that little Oscar and Theo are expected to live short lives but continue to have the biggest smiles.Oscar and Theo have developed a close bond Image: BPM MEDIAByJenny MoodyLiam Buckler:,  Mar |commentsA Staffordshire mum has tragically been told both her sons are unlikely to live past the age of . Courtney Webber has shared her heartbreak that little Oscar and Theo are expected to live short lives but continue to have the biggest smiles. When Oscar was bone, Courtney knew something was wrong when she noticed tremors in his head and yes.However, she was told not to worry, she demanded tests and the now-three-year-old was found he had Pelizaeus-Merzbacher Disease, reports Staffordshire Live.Mrs Webber was pregnant with her second son Theo at the time and invasive tests showed he also had the condition.The -year-old mum was given the agonising option to terminate the pregnancy, but she says she knew in her heart it was the right decision to keep her boy. Pelizaeus-Merzbacher Disease is a rare le-limiting brain condition, affecting only one in , children in the UK. It causes progressive deterioration and the boys have been given a prognosis of around  years. Mrs Webber said: Oscar has the biggest smile in the world - he just lights up the room. Heaposs created the most beautul bond with my nine-month-old. Weaposre watching them grow and flourish together. Itaposs an awful situation weaposre in, but weaposre making the best of it. Iaposve always said there are two roads that you can go down - the dark and dingy road or making the best of the situation. Itaposs how you deal with it - and I always go down the positive path. Itaposs how I am with everything. You could be anxious and stressed all the time, but we do what we can to give them the best quality of le so they can enjoy their childhood. People say Iaposm strong, but I donapost know where I get it from - I guess having children gave me that instinct. We live with this situation and have never had an able child, so weaposve not experienced that. What we know is how to care for children with disabilities. Itaposs about having the right mindset and attitude. It can feel isolating as we are dferent to everyone . We can go to a childaposs party and theyaposll be the only disabled children there. People will look and watch, which they wouldnapost do to any other child. It can be a very isolating feeling so we want to raise awareness of this condition. The boys also have a very special bond with their nanny, Maura Rivers, and sheaposs always there with help and support. The couple had been trying for a baby for three years when they found out they were expecting Oscar not long after getting married. A test at  weeks found they were on the cusp of being a high-risk pregnancy, but it was not until Oscar was born the tremours were noticed. It was not thought to be anything signicant at first, with many doctors telling the couple the same thing, but then they got a call from Birminghamaposs Childrenaposs Hospital after a genetic test - and Oscar was found to have the rare condition. It comes from the X-linked gene and is carried by the mother.If the mum has the gene, then there is a   chance the x-gene will go into the male child and they will inherit the change. Mrs Webber had no idea she was carrying the condition and has urged other parents to keep pushing for answersthey have concerns over their childaposs health. The couple then found out Theo would also be born with the condition. They had to make a devastating decision no parent should be faced with. Mrs Webber said: We were faced with the decision of do we continue with the pregnancy and we had to make it quickly. If we decided to go through with the termination, Iaposd have had to take a tablet to stop the heartbeat and the doctor would deliver the baby. I knew in my heart I had to have Theo. He had as much right to live and we knew weaposd give that baby the world and the best quality of le possible. It was also so Oscar didnapost feel isolated as someone had the same condition as him and they were in it together. Itaposs created that strong bond. I feel for parents whose children have this condition and they donapost know. Iaposd urge them to follow their instincts, as,they donapost, no-one  will. We donapost know how much time theyaposve got, but weaposre glad we know, as we can deal with it. Little Oscar walks with a frame and has a wheelchair, but no problems with talking and cognitive development. He currently has physiotherapy and water therapy to help his movement and there are adaptions around the house to help him.  His family knows his health will deteriorate over time, as will Theoaposs as he gets older, and he will not be able to walk when his muscles become stfer. He may also struggle to swallow his food and will lose basic skills, but his parents are doing all they can to give him the best chance. Mrs Webber has had to give up her job as a property manager to become a full-time carer for her children. She said: It is isolating sometimes but you try to do the best you can. Yes it is heart-breaking but where we are from  months ago is completely dferent. Our mindset is completely dferent and we can talk about it now.The family have been fund-raising so they can create special memories and days out with their sons, while helping with the cost of treatment not covered on the NHS. Family friend Jamie Yeates will be stepping into the boxing ring at Couture Stafford on Friday, March , to take part in a charity boxing match to raise funds. Anyone wanting to sponsor him can do so at https:www.gofundme f oscar-and-theos-pmd-journey-fundraiser. The family also has its own Just Giving page at https:www.justgiving crowdfunding oscarvalentinotheodestefano. title: persistent cough fever tuberculosis not
story: Persistent cough and fever may be tuberculosis not Covid, top UK doctor warnsDr Jenny Harries, chief executive of the UK Health Security Agency, said the Covid pandemic may have resulted in a delay to diagnosis and treatment for TB - which appears to be on the riseUK Health Security Agency Chief Executive, Dr Jenny Harries Image: Press Association ImagesByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Mar |comments A persistent cough and fever should not necessarily be dismissed as Covid as it could be another infectious disease like tuberculosis , a top UK doctor has warned. Dr Jenny Harries, chief executive of the UK Health Security Agency, said the coronavirus pandemic could delay diagnosis and treatment, meaning more undetected cases.Her warning comes after provisional data revealed , cases of TB were recorded in England last year.While Dr Laura Cleghorn, of the University of Dundee warned there is a pressing need to develop new treatments for the illness which some wrongly think of as a disease of yesteryear.The bacterial infection is spread through inhaling tiny droplets from the coughs or sneezes of an infected person.Treatment for the illness has come a long way but it is still a potentially serious condition which needs to be cured using antibiotics, according to the NHS website.Have you tested positive for TB during the Covid pandemic  Let us know at webnews@mirror In , worldwide deaths due to TB ranked second only to Covid, in terms of infectious disease.Dr Harries told the BBC: It is important to remember not every persistent cough, along with fever, is Covid-.A cough that usually has mucus and lasts longer than three weeks can be caused by a range of other issues, including tuberculosis.Meanwhile, campaigners fear the pandemic and conflicts, including the war in Ukraine, have set back crucial funding to halt the spread. Todayis World Tuberculosis Day, with charity the Stop TB Partnership calling for an urgent and substantial increase of funding to fight TB in order to meet the goal of ending the disease by . Dr Lucica Ditiu, the organisationaposs executive director, said:We simply cannot continue to stand on the sidelines and watch while people around the world fall ill and die from a preventable and treatable disease.We also cannot continue to accept what we accepted for years - every year having less than % of the funding need for the TB response. Now we are facing a disastrous funding shortfall, bigger than what we had expected. We not only need to step up efforts to meet targets set at the  UNHLM on TB, but the TB response must also recover from the devastating impacts of the Covid- pandemic. The Stop TB Partnership also warned the Ukraine invasion could have devastating impacts on health services, including the war-torn nationaposs TB treatment programme. The charity is urging all countries taking Ukrainian refugees to put the correct provisions in place to treat those who need it. Last year, Ukraine treated , people with TB including , with a drug-resistant form of the illness. In Britain, a requirement for Ukrainians to take a TB test before arrival has been waived for those on the family scheme visa - though such people will get medical care and testing from GPs. story: Petrol station caught selling fuel at £. per litre despite cost of living crisisCloisters Gulf Petrol Station in Cha, west London has been selling petrol at close to p more per litre than the national average, despite Chancellor Rishi Sunak cutting fuel dutyCloisters Gulf Petrol station in London has some eye watering prices Image: TIM ANDERSONByMilo BoydNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA pumping station that flogged fuel for double the national price during the petrol shortage still has sky high prices following the fuel duty cut. Cloisters Gulf Petrol Station in Cha, west London made headlines in October when it sold out of unleaded petrol - despite selling it for £. a litre. At that point that was double the national average price. Five months on the upmarket fuel dispensary has started shting the combustible liquid for £., p more than its price three weeks ago. The sky high price tag puts it in the running for the most expensive petrol in the UK. The Chancellor announced a p cut in fuel duty, effective as of yesterday evening. After the announcement Asda, Tesco, Sainsburyaposs and Morrisons announced that they would be lowering the cost of their petrol.UK motorists are now being forced to pay an average of £. a litre for unleaded and £. a litre for diesel. That means Cloisters is selling petrol for p more than the typical petrol station. Yesterday RAC head of policy Nicholas Lyes warned that the Chancelloraposs decision to cut fuel duty would only help consumersretailers passed on the savings. There’s also a very real risk retailers could just absorb some or all of the duty cut themselves by not lowering their prices, he said. If this proves to be the case it will be dire for drivers. It also wouldn’t be totally unexpected based on the biggest retailers not reducing their prices late last year when the oil price fell sharply. Changes in prices at the pump are linked to the price of crude oil and the dollar exchange rate. Brent crude was trading down .% on the day at . per barrel on the day - also up  per barrel on the week. Fuel prices first started rising due to high global demand as the UK began to come out of the coronavirus crisis. title: prince harrys lawyer slammed judge
story: Prince Harrys lawyer slammed by judge over "unacceptable breach" of court rulesThe Duke of Sussex is challenging Home Offices decision that he will not be given the same degree of personal protection when he visits the UK with his we and young childrenPrince Harrys lawyer was criticised Image: Getty ImagesByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Mar Prince Harryaposs lawyer has been slammed by a High Court judge for an “entirely unacceptable” breach of court rules, as he attempts to sue the Home Office. Parts of some documents in the Duke of Sussex’s claim against the Home Office will be kept secret the judge ruled as he also criticised his lawyer. Shaheed Fatima QC, for the duke, took full responsibility. The Duke of Sussex is bringing a claim against the department after being told he would no longer be given the “same degree” of personal protective security when visiting from the US, despite offering to pay for it himself. The duke wants to bring his children to visit from the US, but he and his family are “unable toto his home” because it is too dangerous, a representative previously said. He is challenging the February  decision of the Executive Committee for the Protection of Royalty and Public Figures – known as Ravec – which has delegated powers from the Home Secretary.  At a preliminary hearing last month, the High Court in London heard an application by both sides for some parts of the court documents in the case to be kept private. In a judgment on Thursday, Mr Justice Swt said the bid to withhold or redact documents – including a confidential witness statement made by Harry – was allowed. The judge said: “Some of the information relied on concerns security arrangements put in place either for the claimant or for other public figures in the United Kingdom. For obvious reasons information on such matters usually remains confidential.” Mr Justice Swt said that some parts of his reasons for the decision would have to remain confidential as well. He added that editing out information from court documents would “avoid the risk that putting information into the public domain concerning security arrangements made on past occasions, and the general approach to whether andso what arrangements should be made, may impair the effectiveness of arrangements in place now, or which may be put in place in the future”. “Information about these matters would self-evidently be of interest to anyone wishing to harm a person within the scope of the security arrangements and would assist them to piece together previous practice with a view to anticipating present or future security provision,” he continued. Thursday’s ruling only covers the redaction of documents and does not decide the merits of duke’s claim against the Home Office, orit can go to a full hearing. After the judgment was made public, Mr Justice Swt criticised Harry’s legal team for breaking the embargo on the document. High Court judgments are typically provided to lawyers in the case under embargo in a draft form ahead of being made public. However, Mr Justice Swt said that a copy of Thursday’s ruling had been emailed to someone who was not a lawyer, against court rules, calling this “entirely unacceptable”. Shaheed Fatima QC, for the duke, said she and her team were unsure about whether sending the draft judgment last week was a breach, but had decided to report it to the judge on Wednesday. However, the senior judge said it was a “clear breach” and questioned why it had not been raised immediately. Mr Justice Swt continued: “It should have been obvious that what happened was a breach. At the very least, it should have been obvious that it needed to be reported to the judge, me, at as soon as possible.” “It is also unacceptable that you come without an apology to the court,” he later said.  Ms Fatima said she took full responsibility and apologised “for the fact that I didn’t think fully before the emails were sent”. At a hearing last month, Ms Fatima told the court that Harry considers the UK “is and always will be his home”. A representative for Harry previously said the duke wants to fund the security himself, rather than ask taxpayers to foot the bill. However, Robert Palmer QC, for the Home Office, previously told the court the duke’s offer of private funding was “irrelevant”. In written submissions, he said: “Personal protective security by the police is not available on a privately financed basis, and Ravec does not make decisions on the provision of such security on the basis that any financial contribution could be sought or obtained to pay for it.”Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Home OfficePrince HarryRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. story: Puppy who lost ears in worst ever botched illegal cropping gets new homeFourth-month old puppy Martha had to recover from the ordeal at the vets before finally being signed off to join her new familyLiz Price of Dobermann Rescue UK is happy Martha found her forever home Image: Stoke SentinelByLucy WilliamsonReporter:,  Mar |commentsA puppy has finally found her aposforever homeapos after undergoing an illegal procedure to crop some of her ears, suffering the aposworst caseapos of cropping that an animal rescue charity has ever seen.Four-month-old Martha, a Dobermann, whoaposs tail has also been cropped, had to recover from the ordeal at the vets before finally being signed off by the vet to join her new family, StokeonTrent Live reports. She was taken in by Cheddleton-based Dobermann Rescue UK after her ears had become so badly infected after the botched practice that they couldnapost be saved. The charity said it was one of the aposworst casesapos theyaposd ever seen in the country.  Dobermann Rescue UK chair Liz Price says Martha is now recovering well from her ordeal and, due to being too young to live in the charityaposs Bucknall kennels, she is currently being looked after at home by Liz before joining her new family. Liz, who has three Dobermanns of her own, said: The operation has gone really well and she is not at all fazed by it. It hasnapost slowed her down and she is recovering very well. The vet managed to save a small part of her ears and she looks like a little teddy bear now. She will go to her new aposforever homeapos on Wednesday with owners who have been on our waiting list and already have another Dobermann for her to play with. They are delighted to give her a home. Nobody wants to put a puppy through an operation and in an ideal world she would still have the ears she was born with, but it has worked out the best we could hope for. This is a very happy ending to her story. Ear cropping and tail docking is illegal in the UK and in many European countries unless it is carried out by a veterinary surgeon for medical reasons.The RSPCA recently launched a crackdown on ear cropping after recording the highest number of complaints relating to the illegal practice in  since records began in . story: Spiders the size of your palm and able to walk on water on the rise in the UKThe fen raft spider was on the brink of extinction a decade ago but after a rescue project numbers in the UK are thriving once againFen raft spiders are on the rise again in the UK just years after they were almost extinct Image: Chessington World of Adventures resortByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsSpiders the size of a human palm that can walk on water are on the rise in the UK, experts have said.Britainaposs biggest spider species are increasing in numbers for the first time in years - despite being on the verge of extinction a decade ago. The fen raft spider is making an unprecedented comeback. And while arachnophobes will be sweating at the prospect, it is positive news that an endangered species is back from the brink. It is also, thankfully, harmless to humans - and unlikely to be lurking under the sofa. An RSPB report released this week stating numbers of the semi-aquatic fen raft - which has an impressive leg span of three inches - are now into the thousands.  It is the biggest of Britainaposs  spider species. The RSPBaposs Tim Strudwick said: This is one of the UK’s rarest invertebrates, as beautul as any, and we are really proud of the part our reserve and team has played in its recovery. The females are impressive in size, but elegant and quite beautul, even to an arachnophobe .  The best chance of spotting them is in the wetland areas, such as RSPB Strumpshaw Fen in the Norfolk Broads. Tim went on to say: The spiders are only seen in the grazing marsh ditches, and are fairly shy, but they are easy to find from June to September when the mature females have their young. The fen raft spider is a striking creature with a dark body and cream stripes down the side.  It is a protected species under the Wildle and Countryside Act due to its high risk of extinction. A pioneering translocation project between conservation partners and funders - which included the RSPB, as well as the British Arachnological Society, Suffolk and Sussex Wildle Trusts, Natural England, and the Broads Authority - has helped give the species a shot in the arm. Up until  there were only three known populations in the UK, leaving the species very vulnerable and at real risk.  Two years later they were first released onto the RSPB reserve in the hopes of giving the species a chance. But itaposs taken time for a signicant impact to be felt. Nursery webs amounted to just  during the July-October  season. The recently released RSPB Ecology Report assessed the state of Britainaposs wildle, including the struggling fen raft. It showed that in  the total number of females found in the Mid Yare area of the Norfolk Broads is believed to now be in the thousands. It is now present in  one-hectare grid squares at two fens on the Norfolk Broads, the report added. story: UK weather forecast: Brits to bask in C weekend heat before snow and ice sThe Met Office is predicting more hot weather on Friday and Saturday with temperatures in the high teens, above average for the time of year, but then the mercury will drop next weekTemperatures are set to hit C on Friday Image: Adam Gerrard   Daily MirrorByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Brits are set to head to the beaches with scorching temperatures to continue into the weekend but they are being told to make the most of it before an Arctic freeze arrives and theof snow. People enjoyed more sweltering weather on Thursday where the mercury once again hit C with the hottest part of the country being east Yorkshire.The high pressure system is sitting firmly over the UK and promising plenty more blue skies and sunshine for Friday and into the weekend with widespread temperatures in the high teens and reaching C. It means sun lovers are set to pack beaches up and down the country and beer gardens are likely to be bustling. Anyone looking for sun won’t need to head to southern Europe this week with it having been warmer in the UK than the Costas. But unfortunately it is to be short-lived with BBC weather predicting another cold snap around the corner.And maps from WXCharts shows lows of -C in several centimetres of snow at the end of next week in Scotland. “There are some big changes in the weather pattern on the way but not just yet,” said BBC forecaster Darren Bett. “On Thursday despite the haziness of the sunshine temperatures reached C in East Yorkshire, the warmest place in the country. It was a few degrees cooler than that in Scotland and Northern Ireland where we did see more cloud and we still have a weak weather front draped in the Northern Isles bringing some damp weather here. Otherwise it is high pressure that is dominating the weather.  With that stagnant air and no mixing we are continuing to see some poor air quality and we are going to find some high levels of air pollution again across eastern parts in particular on Friday. There is due to be a cold start to Friday before the temperatures rise as has been the case all week. Under that high pressure and clear skies we start the day on a chilly note as we have done on the past few days, said Mr Bett. Temperatures in rural areas will not be far away from freezing. There maybe a few pockets of frost and fog to start the day across Scotland and Northern Ireland but away from Northern Isles there is set to be more sunshine for Scotland and Northern Ireland on Friday. Plenty of sunshine for England and Wales.  He continued: Dry and largely sunny day and quite warm again for the time of year C maybe C for England and Wales. The high pressure is still there across the UK on Saturday. By Sunday, though, and there are set to be more clouds and the temperatures will be a few degrees cooler but still in the mid-teens. Then it is expected to get a lot colder. Into next week though and this is where we see signicant changes not least because we are going to start to see a northerly wind moving down and that will really drop the temperatures, said Mr Bett. As the high recedes early next week we have got the chance of seeing some rain and then that northerly wind arrives it will be much colder by day and also by night.” UK forecast for the next  days Staying fine and dry for most Today: Fine, dry and sunny for most and feeling warm. Cloudier for parts of Scotland, Northern Ireland and northern England. Some rain developing over the Northern Isles and perhaps an isolated afternoon shower over Northern Ireland. Tonight: Dry, clear and chilly for most with some mist and haze for east and southeast England. Cloudier in far N and NW with some light rain for the Northern Isles. Saturday: Fine, sunny and feeling warm for most. Breezier in the south making it cool on some coasts. Cloudier in the north with a little rain for the Northern Isles. Outlook for Sunday to Tuesday: Areas of low cloud and patchy fog retreating to coasts on Sunday less warm across England and Wales. A few showers developing on Monday before turning colder from the north. story: Woman left traumatised after Sunday roast accident burns her tattoo offA salon owner has urged others to take more care in the kitchen after a horric accident while making a Sunday roast, saw boiling water burn off part of her half-sleeve tattooAmber is urging others to be more wary Image: Kennedy News and MediaByCourtney PochinSenior Audience WriterHelen Le Caplain:,  Mar |commentsWhen it comes to cooking, there are a number of potential dangers we have to be aware of. And one mum is reminding everyone to take care - especially around boiling water.Salon owner Amber Bowles says she was left apostraumatisedapos after having an accident in the kitchen while rustling up roast gammon for Sunday lunch. The -year-old from Great Yarmouth in Norfolk accidentally spilt boiling water down herself while draining a pan of par-boiled potatoes and ended up aposburning offapos a tattoo. Amber says the horric accident was caused when she caught the handle of the pan on the hob grate.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here. The mum-of-one ended up pouring boiling water down her right arm as a result - accidentally getting it all over her half tattoo sleeve of a woman and a floral design.She ended up with a severe third-degree burn, with huge blisters bubbling up on a x-inch patch on her arm, causing nerve damage and aposburning offapos part of her tattoo. Amberaposs partner, -year-old salesman Zack Brown rushed her to James Paget Hospitalaposs AE department where doctors popped and scraped the blisters before applying antibacterial cream and burns dressings.Given the severity of the injury, Amber then had to visit a specialist burns hospital where was told she may need a skin graft, but luckily she healed well enough that she didnapost need one. The injury was so painful Amber found herself unable to work in her salon over Christmas - one of the busiest periods of the year for beauty treatments. Now, four months on from her ordeal back in November, Amber is urging people to be aposmore waryapos in the kitchen so they donapost go through the agonising experience she did. She said: The accident has burned the tattoo off. Iaposve got a womanaposs face and a big flower. Half her head is missing and then half of the flower and all the leaves has gone as well. The doctors didnapost think it would go that deep to take the tattoo off, they thought the tattoo would come back, but the burn went quite deep so it took all of the ink out of the skin. It went that deep it damaged all my nerve endings too. I was really traumatised by it.  Amber continued: I usually do a roast every Sunday, itaposs a meal Iaposm really good at making and something I enjoy doing. In the last year Iaposve been really trying to nail the roast dinners. I was doing roast potatoes. I peeled all the potatoes, put them in a big silver pot to boil with salt and a bit of oil before I put them in the oven. I went to pick the big pot up but the handles were too hot so I grabbed a tea towel and picked the pot up. It contained water that had been boiling for about  minutes. The tea towel then got caught and the whole of the pot went all over my right arm, hand, thumb and wrist. I just remember this excruciating pain. I donapost know how I even managed it but I managed to put the pot back down and then screamed for my partner and my mum.  I got to the tap as quickly as I could and I put it under the cold water tap. Iaposve given birth [was in labour] for  hours and that wasnapost even on par with that.It felt like my arm was on fire. As soon as I saw my arm under the cold water tap my skin was just peeling off and thataposs when I knew it was bad.My whole body went into shock and I was just screaming. Zack came down, he was just as shocked as I was. I had it under the water for  minutes and then he rushed me to hospital. Once I got to hospital thataposs when I started to get blisters, there were about eight or nine and they were big - some were the size of a £ coin. I thought it was best to leave them but they popped them and then peeled all the skin back, which was awful. It was absolutely agonising. I was there for about an hour, they were pretty quick and were really good. Amber admits that after the accident she initially didnapost cook again for a while but sheaposs now back in the kitchen and wants to urge others to be aposmore waryapos and take their time. She added: It wasnapost very nice losing my tattoo but because they thought I was going to have to have a skin graft I was trying to look at things positively. Iaposm glad itaposs taken half of my tattoo off rather than burn my face or my daughter. I couldnapost believe Iaposd done it, I still canapost. After I did it I didnapost cook for a while, I didnapost go near a hob. Now Iaposm ok but Iaposm very wary. Before I burned myself Iaposd be doing multiple things at once and rushing. Now I do not rush, I take my time and make sure my little girlaposs not there just in case. My advice to people is to be more wary when in the kitchen.Do you have a story to sell  We want to hear all about it. story: Wreckage of -year-old whaling ship destroyed in storm found in Gulf of MexicoThe US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration unearthed Industry, a -foot-long vessel which was cast to the bottom of the sea when a strong storm snapped its mastIndustry was sunk in  Image: NOAA Ocean Exploration NewsflashByJoe GolderMilo BoydNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments The wreck of a -year-old whaling ship that was sailed by descendants of enslaved people has been discovered. The US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administrationfound the vessel Industry beneath the waves in the Gulf of Mexico.The -foot-long ship, or what remains of it, was operated by the descendants of African enslaved people and Native Americans in one of the nationaposs oldest industries, the organisation said. Researchers found the boat at a depth of , feet. The ship was used to hunt whales across the Atlantic Ocean, the Caribbean and the Gulf of Mexico for  years.  A statement from NOAA read: It was lost when a strong storm snapped its masts and opened its hull to the sea on May , . Industry was whaling primarily for sperm whales more than  miles off the mouth of the Mississippi River. It is the only whaling ship known to have been lost in the Gulf of Mexico out of  whaling voyages from the s to the s. The crew members were reportedly picked up by another vessel, named the Elizabeth, which took them back to port.The NOAA statement continued: While the crew list for the last voyage of Industry disappeared when the ship sank, lists of crews from previous voyages describe crewmembers and officers as including Black people, Native Americans, White people and multiracial people. The brig is connected to the le of Paul Cuffe, a mariner and entrepreneur whose father was a freed slave and mother was a Wampanoag Indian.  Cuffe started whaling as a teenager and rose to become a successful ship builder, merchant, abolitionist, philanthropist, founder of an integrated public school and among the leaders of a project to settle freed Black people in a new colony in Africa. His son William was a navigator on Industry and his son-in-law, Pardon Cook, was an officer on the brig, and believed to have made the most whaling voyages of any Black person in American history. The presence of African and Native American crew members is signicant, given the widespread slavery and discrimination of both people at the time. NOAA Administrator DR Rick Spinrad said: Today we celebrate the discovery of a lost ship that will help us better understand the rich story of how people of colour succeeded as captains and crew members in the nascent American whaling industry of the early s.  The discovery reflects how African Americans and Native Americans prospered in the ocean economy despite facing discrimination and other injustices. It is also an example of how important partnerships of federal agencies and local communities are to uncovering and documenting our nationaposs maritime history. NOAA vessel Okeanos Explorer controlled a remote vehicle using a satellite link to explore the seafloor on Friday,  February. The findings have just been made public. US Deputy Secretary of Commerce Don Graves said: Black and Native American history is American history, and this critical discovery serves as an important reminder of the vast contributions Black and Native Americans have made to our country. This th century whaling ship will help us learn about the lives of the Black and Native American mariners and their communities, as well as the immense challenges they faced on land and at sea. news weird-news couple-who-moved-converted-van-"Couple who live in van full-time show off mini fireplaceByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A couple who decided to pack in their normal lives in favour of living like nomads have been forced to give up the dream, after increasing fuel prices made it near impossible for them to travel.Marie-Laure Parsy Szikola moved back home to Edinburgh in the pandemic, but quickly found herself itching to travel - especially after becoming furloughed from her job. So, the -year-old decided to pitch the idea of the nomad lestyle, living from a van, to her fiancé, Alan, who has actually lived that way before - in a bid to see the world on a budget. The couple had been living in a small flat at the time, and managed to save enough money to buy a Mercedes Vario d minibus for £, in July , which they called aposBlue.apos  Marie said: As experienced trekkers and overall outdoor enthusiasts, we wanted a le that gave us freedom to find a place to hike, climb or kayak and just go. For someone with an adventurous background, staying indoors was a real challenge and I felt it truly impacted my well-being – both mentally and physically. I got furloughed and the lack of mental stimulation didn’t help at all. I wanted a way of le that would be more engaging than the mainstream: job, commute, flat. So, the couple packed up their things, gave up the flat and began travelling across Scotland, including the islands, in their new home Blue. But they have found themselves unable to fully satisfy their wanderlust and travel across the world so far – with the rising cost of living and fuel prices a contributing factor.  Marie continued: With fuel prices being so high at the moment, there’s more importance than having a constant adventure. Obviously the idea of being non-stop on the road is appealing, but the certainty that comes from a regular income is important. Fortunately though, the couple are still managing to save plenty of money thanks to their unique way of le. Living in the van is saving them an estimated £, a month in rent and between £- in council tax and bills. They spend £ a week on water disposal and water but are largely self-reliant – with electricity generated from solar  in the van. Despite being limited to the local area for now, the couple have still managed to turn their unusual abode into a home. Although the bus was already converted, the couple added their own touch by replacing the handles for £ and the original colour scheme for £. She said: The previous owners of the bus already did a superb job by converting it using wood and carving details all around. We love detail and our work is more an add-on with dferent paint schemes, hardware and soft furnishings. The bus is a canvas of our lives and we are trying to craft the bus so that every corner reflects a part of our personalities and tastes. In total, they have spent £ making the vehicle feel like home and managed to keep costs low by re-using decor from their previous flat. For now, despite their lack of travel plans, the adventurous couple have no plans toto rented accommodation. Marie said: Van le makes you feel independent and more confident in yourself as it forces you to deal with breakdowns, climate and nature. You feel more engaged with your le and in a sense, more in control. It’s helped me to re-find a path and series of goals when my le hit a standstill. The positives about this way of le is a sense of freedom, which is met by daily challenges. Everything can and will break in a van, but patience, a good dose of humour and the ability to learn quickly will turn hassles into fun. It doesn’t need to be full-on straight away to be enjoyable and it can be done on a wide range of budgets. Everybody on the road has their own story and reasons to take this way of le, but I would advise anyone to start by hiring a van first for a weekend or short holiday. Get the feel for it first andyou decide to take the step, always make sure you know where your next pay check will come from. As the hours ticked by, the parents got increasingly worried and waited by the door for her until she eventually ed home at :am. She tried her hardest to go undetected, he said, as she quietly parked the car on the drive and opened the front door without making much noise. But of course, sheaposd been caught red-handed. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. When the couple asked her for an explanation, she answered honestly and told them that sheaposd gone over to her boyfriendaposs house after dropping her grandparents off. I told her as punishment that she is grounded for the rest of the school year and that she would not get to go to her senior prom, in spite of her already picking out a prom dress, he said. But thataposs not all. Her other punishments included: no access to the car until graduation, no iPhone, no friends, no going outside, and her prom dress will be donated. While my we agrees with most of the punishments Iaposve laid out, she does not think she should have to miss her senior prom, especially since it was cancelled last school year, he added. My least-favourite part of parenting is having to dish out consequences for undesirable behaviour, but what our daughter did crossed the line and worried us.As such, I told my we that I need to stick to my guns in every part of her punishment, but sheaposs hellbent on letting our daughter at least attend prom. He concluded his post by asking: Should we let her off of her grounding for prom, or should I stick to my word  Reddit users were quick to share their thoughts on the situation, many of which said his punishment was too harsh. One person said: Dude, [youaposre the a**hole]. Did she break the rules and acted like a complete dumba** while making you worried  Absolutely. Does it warrant a punishment  Of course, it does. Should that punishment be her missing a once-in-a-letime event that would otherwise be a fond memory sheaposd look years down the lane and will now only remember your cruel punishment  Do you really want it to be so  Punishment should fit the crime, and yours is waaaay overblown. Another agreed: One instance of breaking curfew and you go completely scorched earth. Obviously, there should be consequences but it’s not like she burnt down your house, she went to see her boyfriend. A third commented: My Dad took my prom away from me as well  I never got that experience everyone  did. Our relationship is very strained to this day. story: Lad roasts pals abysmal dinners his mum lovingly makes - as some are unidentiableClem Johnson regularly shares pictures of his dinner with his friends but the meals are roasted by his friend Owen Southwood - who says some are unidentiablePie and crackers was one of the worst dishes on the list Image: Kennedy News and MediaByZahna EklundAudience writerSophie Norris:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A lad who shares pictures of the meals his mum lovingly cooks for him with his friends in a group chat has seen the dinners mercilessly mocked online after one of his pals started a thread on Twitter just to review the abysmal dishes. Clem Johnson, , first started sharing the pictures of his mumaposs cooking with his mates as a laugh as he found himself constantly being served bizarre dinners such as microwaved bacon, pie with cream crackers, and spaghetti with ketchup. The Liverpool season ticket holder often joked to his pals that some of the meals were unidentiable, and his friends would get involved with the banter, as one even said his dinner looked like it had been cooked in a washing machine. Clemaposs friend Owen Southwood, , was so stunned by the array of strange dishes his mate was eating that he just had to share it with the world - and posted hilarious reviews of the dishes on Twitter.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The thread attracted more than , likes and , retweets, and Owen admitted the pie and crackers dish was among the worst heaposd ever seen. He said: He’s taking the p**s [out of the meals] with most of the pictures. I think he doesn’t mind the spaghetti and sausages but for the rest of them, he’s taking the p**s. We all just send our food in whenever we make something that looks nice, so he does the opposite. It started about two months ago with the sausages and spaghetti. His mum cooks the majority of them. Some of them caused more of a stir in the group than others.  The best-looking one is probably the curry - it looks edible and would probably taste okay. The worst one was the spaghetti with egg and bacon. We voted as a group that it was the worst meal we’d ever seen. The egg and chips weren’t even that bad really - it’s just the presentation. The pie on crackers got called worse than rations. And Clem says he lets his mum cook the dinners as he hates cooking, but he loves seeing the reaction of horried people online. He explained: Iaposve been sending them in for ages as a laugh to see their reaction. I hate cooking it’s just too much effort for five minutes to eat. I live with my mum so she cooks.  Owen said aposenoughaposs enough - it’s going on Twitterapos. All my mates have been laughing for ages. I didn’t think it’d go viral on Twitter though. The reaction onlineaposs been funny. At first, I tried to keep it anonymous but loads of people worked out it was me. I reckon chip and eggs isn’t even that bad. Pie and crackers were definitely a low. I saw that a lad donated £ to a food bank, so that’s all that matters. I don’t go hungry so all good. One of Owenaposs Twitter reviews read: Without doubt the single worst meal I have EVER seen consumed, there are starving refugees who would turn their nose up at this, the bacon was also cooked in the microwave.   While another said: This is supposed to be a fajita, the block of what looks like butter is a solid block of cheese and yes they are baked beans. .  And although Clem is in on the joke, he also took to Twitter to encourage those who laugh at his scran to do what they can to donate to food banks. He tweeted: Now youaposve all had your laugh, can I be serious  Ye my scranaposs s**t, but I’ve got something on my plate. Loads of people don’t. story: Horrors of ‘butcher of Mariupol’ who ordered Russian forces to bomb maternity wardRussian Colonel-General Mikail Mizintsev is the suspected mastermind behind the relentless bombing of Mariupol which is now up to  per cent destroyed or damaged, according to Ukrainian authoritiesChief of the National Centre for State Defense Control Colonel-General Mikhail Mizintsev has been dubbed the butcher of Mariupol Image: Getty ImagesByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Bombing a maternity ward in Mariupol and gassing children in Syria are a few of the horrors ordered by an evil Russian colonel.Russian Colonel-General Mikhail Mizintsev has been dubbed the butcher of Mariupol as heaposs the suspected mastermind behind the relentless bombing of the city.Mariupol was home to , people before the war broke out on February  and now up to  per cent of the city has been destroyed or damaged, according to Ukrainian authorities.Col Mizintsev is officially known as the director of the Russian National Centre for Defence Management and has been accused of being behind the bombing of maternity hospital as well as the shelling of an art school that was being used as a bomb shelter for residents.  Sergey Bratchuk, a spokesman for the Odesa military administration, accused the bloodthirsty colonel of ordering several devastating strikes in Mariupol, which has led to hundreds of civilian deaths. Bratchuk wrote: He ordered the bombing of a maternity hospital, childrenaposs hospital, drama theatre, and civilian homes. All who lay down their arms are guaranteed safe passage out of Mariupol. The Ukrainian government has claimed that attempts to establish humanitarian corridors out of the city have been disrupted by attacks from Russiaaposs military.Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletin here  Olexander Scherba, Ukraineaposs former Ambassador to Austria, branded Col Mizintsev the Butcher of Mariupol as he shared an intercepted audio clip between himself and a junior officer. In a translation tweeted out by Scherba, it should Col Mizintsev calling a soldier who was not wearing his unorm the scum of the highest order. He is recorded saying: Why is his face not mutilated yet  Why hasnapost anyone cut off his ears  Why isnapost this moron limping yet   At night, when he walks out, unknown assailants jump him. Just jump him over and over, beating him in the face with a bottle and then pouring another litre into it. Col Mizintsev is said to have orchestrated Russiaaposs involvement in the Syrian Civil War between  and . Russian forces carried out a series of airstrikes, including the sieging of Aleppo, which left , civilians dead.  It is likely the high-ranking officer played a key role in the shelling of Aleppo. It was widely reported at the time that Russian troops used cluster munitions and barrel bombs in built-up urban areas in Syria to inflict maximum casualties on civilians. Government forces also reportedly dropped chlorine in Aleppo in a series of devastating gas attacks. In April , a chemical attack was carried out in the Syrian city of Douma, killing almost  people and injuring well over .Mariupol is in southeastern Ukraine between the annexed territory of Crimea and Russian-backed separatist forces in the Donbas region. Mariupolaposs location as a port city on the Black Sea is also important to the Ukrainian economy as an industrial powerhouse. Mariupol makes steel, repairs ships and is responsible for the production of heavy machinery, vital to both Ukraineaposs war effort and its economy. title: inside vladimir putins life secret
story: Inside Vladimir Putin’s le of secret children, a mysterious partner and his mega-wealthRussian President Vladimir Putin is thought to have a billion mansion known as Putins Palace and a £m superyacht at the centre of his rumoured hefty portfolioVladimir Putin has long been rumoured to be in a relationship with gymnast Alina Kabaeva Image: Kremlin.ru  Eastwest NewsByMilo BoydNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsVladimir Putin aposs mysterious family le and reported mega-wealth has come under the spotlight as his countryaposs invasion of Ukraine reaches the one month mark.The Russian leader, who learned the dark arts of intelligence in east Germany with the KGB, is an intensely private man. And yet rumours of a vast private income eclipsing that of the worldaposs richest people, secret relationships and a partner hidden from view have circulated for years. Information has slowly leaked out, despite Putinaposs command to Russian media outlets that: I have a private le in which I do not permit interference. It must be respected. Here is what we known about the Russian president.  The wealth A billion mansion known as aposPutinaposs Palaceapos and a £m superyacht are believed to be highlights of his portfolio - but there are also reports he has  other homes,  planes and helicopters,  cars and a watch collection worth , The Russian president is even known to have flaunted his power through ownership of outlandish pets - including a tiger called Boris, who he released into the wild on live TV in . Speaking to the Washington Post, hedge fund manager Bill Browder estimated Putinaposs wealth was around billion USD - but his fortune is surrounded by mystery.While itaposs well-known that Putin owns several luxury properties in Russia, one particular mansion reported to belong to the Russian president has turned heads in recent weeks.The so-called aposPutinaposs Palace,apos which is thought to be worth more than  billion, was reportedly built for Putinaposs personal use.  In January nearly  photos of the lavish mansion were published by Alexei Navalnyaposs Anti-Corruption Fund, set up by the outspoken Putin critic who is now in jail. Georgy Alburov, a researcher for the Foundation, said the palace was decorated in a style similar to that youaposd expect from King Louis XIV. In , Newsweek reported the Russian president had ordered the production of a bulletproof fleet of limos in Russia, estimated to be worth  million. While Putin has no problem showing off how much money he has tied up in assets, heaposs less forthcoming about where the money came from in the first place. There have been a number of estimates about just how wealthy Putin and his family is, with one speculating he could be worth as much as up to £billion. That would make him richer than Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos. Ex-we  Putinaposs current relationship status is a bit of a mystery, amid speculation that he moved on very quickly after separating from his we of  years. He admitted he had a habit of leading a bacheloraposs le until it was uprooted by former air hostess Lyudmila Putina. They met in their home city of Leningrad, now St Petersburg, when a mutual friend invited Putin to see a play along with several girlfriends. Putin is said to have hidden that he worked as a KGB spy for much of their three-year courtship and they married in July . The couple had two daughters, Mariya, in April , and Yekaterina, in August , after they had moved to Germany when Putin was stationed as a Soviet spy. Working  and -hour days took its toll on his family le and in June  they announced they were separating just weeks before their th wedding anniversary. Appearing on state television after attending a ballet together, Putin admitted that rumours he and his we no longer lived together were true and she had done with her sht as Russiaaposs First Lady.In the wake of Putin’s Ukraine invasion, Katerinaaposs French holiday home in Biarritz was vandalised with the colours of the Ukrainian flag. The secret lover Over the years, Putin has been dogged by rumours of an affair, something which he has always denied.But they were compounded when political rival Alexi Navalny claimed he had wed former Olympic gymnast Alina Kabaeva in a secret ceremony.Kabaeva won a gold medal for Russia at the Athens Olympics Games in  before retiring from the sport and entering politics.Once regarded as Russiaaposs most eligible woman, the only other suitor she has been linked to by the media was a married Georgian policeman but this relationship was said to have petered out by . Rumours first linked Alina, who is  years younger than Putin, romantically to the Russian leader as long ago as  when she was a pro-Kremlin MP. Many Russians saw her as the reason for the breakup of Putin’s marriage Lyudmila and believed she had become the new Russian First Lady.  There have been frequent reports that Putin is the alleged father of up to five children with Kabaeva, who vanished completely in . One popular Russian newspaper called her the First Lady, but in the shadows. She reportedly gave birth to Putinaposs son Dmitry in , before a daughter arrived in , another alleged child in  before the birth of twin boys in . Around the time of the most recent births she was awarded the the countryaposs highest civilian medal For Merit to the Fatherland by Putin.After not being seen for two-and-a-half years, Kabaeva dramatically reappeared in public last summer to renounce Tokyo  judges after Russian star Dina Averina failed to win a gold medal in rhythmic gymnastics. The children As for Putinaposs official children, he likes to keep them away from the cameras and little is known about their lives. Eldest daughter Maria, , has a career in medical research and is an expert on dwarfism, according to reports. She is married to Dutch businessman, Jorrit Faassen, and is believed to be the mother of Putinaposs two confirmed grandchildren, who were born in  and . Meanwhile, Katerina, , goes by the family name of her maternal grandmother, Tikhonova, and is a former acrobatic dancer. She has a degree in physics and mathematic and is now spearheading a major Russian articial intelligence initiative.  Putinaposs second eldest daughter was married to Russia’s youngest billionaire, Kirill Shamalov, but they reportedly separated in . The thing is, I don’t want them to grow up like hereditary princes, I want them to grow up to be normal people, Putin told Russian TV in . If I mention ages and names, they would be identied and never left alone. One of Putin’s alleged love children was unmasked as Elizaveta Krivonogikh in November . It has been claimed that her mother Svetlana Krivonogikh, , had an affair with the strongman leader when he was head of the FSB counterintelligence service. Putinaposs alleged current partner Kabaeva, , is said to be holed up in a very private and very secure chalet in Switzerland, a source told Page Six.  The couple are thought to have had four secret children together, although there has never been any official confirmation of either their relationship or their kids. Alina has two young boys and twin girls with Putin who were born in Switzerland, the source added. The kids all have Swiss passports, and I imagine she does also. Kabaeva is now facing calls to be kicked out of Switzerland and deport her to Russia. A petition to do so has now gained more than , signatories.
